reviews.title: Not For Young Kids
reviews.text: I have yet to see someone state the obvious. The pool is TOPLESS!!!!!!! I could understand the beach being topless but not the pool. I had two 12 year old girls that were upset. The reviews all indicated a family resort. I do not think topless at the main pool is very family- friendly. The pool closed at 6:00, which was a bummer. The El Pueblito staff was very friendly. The only person we had a problem with was Marcela, who was suppose to be helping us with some bus routes but ending up setting us help for a "not a timeshare" meeting. She kept hounding us when we didn't show up. The entertainment staff could get a little nasty for younger kids. The food was average. The nightly shows were excellent. The rooms were just something you would go to sleep in and not hang out in. If I did not have children to bring to the resort, I might would stay here again.

reviews.title: Had a fantastic stay at the El Pueblito
reviews.text: I have just returned from the El Pueblito and had one of the best holidays ever. I agree with some of the other reviews that the food choice was not great but this is the 5th time I have gone All Inclusive, having been to the Dominican Repulic, Cuba and previously to a different area of Mexico and it wasn't much different to any of these. The hotel was the cleanest I have ever stayed in, you see people cleaing throughout the day, and the staff were the friendliest. They weren't all just after tips, we didn't tip until our last day and the service didn't change from the staff just because they didn't get a tip each night. They couldn't do enough for you and you rarely had to wait more than a minute or two to get a drink, in fact one usually arrive before you had to ask for it. The entertainment staff were brilliant and the shows really good. I would definitely recommend the El Pueblito and disagree that this is an '18-30' hotel, there were people ranging from babies to those in their 60's when I stayed there and they all received the same service from the staff.

reviews.title: Absolutely Fantastic
reviews.text: El Pueblito, Cancun was the best hotel we have stayed in. It had a great Mexican theme, with brilliant, friendly staff and was so clean you could eat your meals off the floor. Nothing was ever too much of an ask for the staff.

reviews.title: A great alternative to the ugly cement hi-rises in Cancun!
reviews.text: I will recommend this hotel to anybody from coupless wanting a quiet romantic holiday to families wanting a peaceful time away from rowdy party goers.

reviews.title: best holiday ever
reviews.text: The hotel is the problem, very cheap in all. Good for very young people who have never travelled anywhere before. At least the city is near so you have lots of restaurants around...Rooms were smeely and my air conditionner didn't work. Don't forget to tip if you want service!

reviews.title: loved the el pueblito
reviews.text: we just got back from cancun, IVAN, and the El pueblito.....we had a ball.....the eye of the hurricane went over Cuba, but we felt the wind and saw the hugh waves...we were not allowed into the ocean the whole time we were there, but we didnt care...the staff were soooo nice. yes, i will agree the area where we ate all our meals was hot and sticky, but thats Mexico...the waiters were extremely sweet and caring, catering to your every need....hey the coffee is even great there....always tip the waiter and the egg lady. since our stay was all inclusive and the meals were virtually free..we tipped $5.00 every meal and they were running over each other to accomodate us......by the way we were there for the Mexican Independence Day celebration....man, can they put on a show and we met some wonderful people....as for the rooms, yes it is the only rooms that are air conditioned (except for the little gift shop) but they were kept clean and that marble floor felt really good on your feet......When we go back, we WILL stay at the El Pueblito...WE LOVED IT.

reviews.title: I had the time of my life
reviews.text: Where do i begin? The moment we entered the hotel I felt as though it was my second home, the staff are so caring and friendly. The rooms are standard, however all you do is sleep there, cancun has got so much to do. although the rooms are standard they are cleaned well every morning. The gardens and pool are kept in imaculate condition, you will always see someone cleaning. The entertainment was excellent, the guys (Horacio, Usi) are so much fun not to forget george and mario. The food is also good,you have a huge variety throughout the whole day. everyone made me feel so welcome from the waiters, bar staff, reception all of them are brilliant the hotel as a whole made my holiday the best!!!!!!!!! Keep smiling El pueblito, Ill be back!!!!see you next year in 2005.

reviews.title: great place for cheap vacation
reviews.text: If you're not a snob are out to have a relaxing holiday with lovely people, nice atmosphere, and loads of fun then head to the el pueblito. oh and if you are a snob the only way youll be happy is if you have a penthouse suite in the Hilton

reviews.title: great place for youth
reviews.text: This place is beautiful. Right on the ocean, the cool breeze made the hot days bearable. Every room has a balcony and are all different from each other. Service was good, we got all we wanted and more. For what we paid, this was a great place for 6 young guys. Age was varied and many people were over 40, but a good mix, not the young hormone filled place the reviews described.

reviews.title: First trip, and we loved it.
reviews.text: Food was ok, but we knew going in it was not going to be excellent. They have enough food to get by, snaks were great and breakfast saved the meals. Drinks got weaker as we went on, but we would get a drink and then a shot to put in the drink. Nothing was stolen as we did not really give the maids a chance to clean our rooms. This is a great place for someone who is not snobby and can acclimate themselves to a different culture.

My husband and I went to El Pueblito on September 11-19/04 and i'll say i was nervous being my first time flying and away from home but El Pueblito was amazing, we had a fantastic time, the service was great, my room was cute and was cleaned everyday with clean towels, the staff was so helpful and very polite, the entertainment staff( usi, jimmy & horacio) were funny, made eveyone welcome and made us feel like their friends. My room #3211 was a nice and cute room, a/c worked so good, hot water, and t.v worked good too. The food was ok,, and the titanic drinks were awsome. The actual resort was a mexican atmosphere that i really loved the most, i wanted to feel the mexican feeling, and it was wonderful. The best part was meeting a few friends, and having the time of my life. I would reccomend this resort to anyone who want a mexican village style, great service, friendly staff, and the most amazing time ever. I will for sure return next year and this time i'll bring my 5 and 2 year old daughters, seeing for myself how the resort has great pools and fun stuff for them to do.
reviews.title: el pueblito was just fine
Stay far far away!!
reviews.text: Was in Cancun January 30th of 2004 till Feb. 5th. El pueblito was not the most luxurious hotel I' ve ever stayed in but for the amount of time we spent in the hotel it was just fine. All we did was sleep, eat and shower there we were gone every day on tours. The beach in front of the hotel was absolutely amazing. The staff was very nice. One guy in particular was the guy at the tours desk in the hotel. I can't remember his name but we were so impressed we tipped him $25us before we left. He was a tremendous help in booking tours and went out of his way to help us. The food was not the greatest but it was alright. Sometimes we didn't eat there anyways if we were gone all day. Cancun is worth every last penny. I went swimming with the dolphins at isla mujueres it was amazing. I will never forget that experience!!!! I am going back to cancun January 23 2005 and will be staying at the royal park pyramids hopefully it's nice there. Oh ya the air conidtion didn't work in our room.
